article.Heading: Budget 2016: Let there be strong criticism of government, says Modi
article.Summary: "Hope there will be extensive discussion on issues of people during Parliament's Budget Session. I wish that Parliament session will be fruitful and there is constructive criticism as well," Modi said on Tuesday.
article.Body:
Ahead of the Budget session of Parliament, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said he hoped the Budget Session will be fruitful as several opposition parties have showed a positive attitude at all party meetings.

"Hope there will be extensive discussion on issues of people during Parliament's Budget Session. I wish that Parliament session will be fruitful and there is constructive criticism as well," Modi said on Tuesday.

"There were several meetings held with the opposition parties and all the leaders have shown positive attitude and understanding. The opposition has shown a positive attitude. I am hopeful of a constructive debate session in parliament. Even if there is criticism, it should be about the weakness of the government which can further help the country," Modi said.

The Budget session of Parliament began on Tuesday.
